{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3087728,"name":"Berke Sinan Yetkin","username":"Just_A_Bored_Fella","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/b5a626/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-10-10T07:07:11.177Z","cooked":"

Hi,

We are experimenting with single channel encoders and no matter what we do, we can’t get wpilib.Counter to work.

2022pendik.zip (326.3 KB)

Here’s the code, We tried everything in wpi.edu docs; but it was no help, neither in simulation nor on a real rio.

Thanks for taking the time to help,
-Berke

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2022-10-10T07:07:38.744Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":106.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":415978,"topic_slug":"counter-doesnt-work","display_username":"Berke Sinan Yetkin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"/uploads/short-url/iPdf5X6jJ3dHdOx0NAdkXa8Zi7Z.zip","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/how-to-ask-questions-about-programming/415365/13","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"How to Ask Questions About Programming","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48509,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software"},"post_url":"/t/counter-doesnt-work/415978/1","custom_user_title":"Software","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3087734,"name":"Berke Sinan Yetkin","username":"Just_A_Bored_Fella","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/b5a626/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-10-10T09:49:02.570Z","cooked":"

So, we solved the problem by ditching our test bed -a limit switch- for just some simple jumper wires; turns out the 10k resistor we have on our limit switch was causing some problems.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2022-10-10T09:49:06.934Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":32.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":415978,"topic_slug":"counter-doesnt-work","display_username":"Berke Sinan Yetkin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48509,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software"},"post_url":"/t/counter-doesnt-work/415978/2","custom_user_title":"Software","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3087768,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-10T14:05:06.238Z","cooked":"
Just_A_Bored_Fella:

-a limit switch-

Looking at a Counter on a limit switch is very instructive to show that debouncing is useful. It’s amazing how many counts you get opening and closing one of those mechanical micro switches.

I don’t know why you had a resistor on the switch but my team has used resistors without trouble. Wire length can be problem; the limit isn’t particularly long especially with resistors.

You didn’t say why you thought the Counter wasn’t working. I didn’t look at your code much since there is a ton of code to hunt through for your Counter.

I’m glad you found your problem - good job. I hope you didn’t fool yourself into thinking that a limit switch on the robot was ever going to be as clean of a contact as a jumper at the input. That’s why WPILib docs for years has shown how to debounce with a Counter and later provided debouncing methods.
